intro: Umbilicus libanoticus var. lineatus, commonly known as the Lebanotic umbilic, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of the Middle East. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral-shaped leaves that spiral upward from a central stem, giving it a striking visual appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring season, which are arranged in clusters along the stem. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a waxy texture, which helps it conserve moisture in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
